newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea to allow more domestic securities houses.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea to allow more domestic securities houses.

text.p: South Korea's finance and economy ministry said on Wednesday it would allow domestic companies to set up wholly owned securities houses under new requirements to be announced later.
South Korean companies had been barred from setting up securities houses for the past 20 years with only joint ventures allowed, a finance ministry official said.
"We will prepare detailed requirements. New securities houses which would be wholly owned by domestic companies would probably be allowed from the end of this year or early next year," he said.
At present, the government-set minimum capital requirement for securities house is 50 billion won.
